justification: A’s ask fits its own goals (workhorse RB for playoffs) but doesn’t model B’s mindset. B prefers stable floors, possession WRs, and injured buy-lows; Allen is a high-variance deep threat and Caleb Turner is a committee back, so the package misaligns with B’s preferences. The proposal ignores B’s SoS/OL focus and consensus-driven approach. The trade itself is feasible and coherent, but the rationale is brief and A-centric, offering little evidence B would accept.
